SEARCH
Package sprouts.impl

Interface SequenceDiffOwner

public interface SequenceDiffOwner
This interface is a sort of marker interface for Tuple implementations that can provide a SequenceDiff object that describes the difference between the current tuple and a previous one (if any), in terms of a SequenceChange, the index of the change, and the number of changes. When using the observer pattern, the observer can keep track of the changes and update the target sequence accordingly.
This is mostly a Sprouts internal interface and is not intended for widespread use, but rather a well contained optimization technique.

Note that this is deliberately not part of the public API because it is an internal optimization technique that breaks the promise of the Tuple interface of having an identity solely based on the contents of the tuple. Due to the SequenceDiff being part of the tuple, if the SequenceDiff were a public property of the tuple, then the "true value based" identity of the tuple would also have to be based on this diff, which would make tuples with the same contents but different diffs not equal to each other. This would be a violation of the contract of the Tuple interface.

Although this interface along with the SequenceDiff class were specifically designed for the Tuple type, it is possible to use this interface with other immutable value based sequenced collections to do optimized synchronization to state changes.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Optional<SequenceDiff>
    differenceFromPrevious()
    Provides a SequenceDiff object that describes the difference between the current tuple and a previous one (if any), in terms of a SequenceChange, the index of the change, and the number of changes.

  • Method Details

    • differenceFromPrevious

      Optional<SequenceDiff> differenceFromPrevious()
      Provides a SequenceDiff object that describes the difference between the current tuple and a previous one (if any), in terms of a SequenceChange, the index of the change, and the number of changes. Use this at a consumer side to keep track of the changes and update the target object only according to the changes that have occurred, instead of rebuilding the target sequence entirely every time a change occurs.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the SequenceDiff object if there is a difference between the current tuple and a previous one, or an empty Optional otherwise.
